intro: Callianthe elegans, commonly known as the elegant callianthe, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Callianthe elegans is often cultivated for its vibrant blooms and is adapted to grow in well-drained, moist soils.
